result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis Gerard Gentner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on10/28/22 by 1:00 PM
- 1 day credit against ultimate sentence

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dennis Gerard Gentner

records.addlTxt: added assessments. e: DA, Atty Schutte, and DOC     e: DE and SCSO    email: Jail  arc
e: DOC arc

8:35 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Dennis Gerard Gentner in court.  Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Dennis Gerard Gentner.  Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. There is an agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to AMENDED count 1; 346.62(4) - Reckless Driving Class I felony. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of the AMENDED Ct 1 -reckless driving. Sentencing recommendations.

Crt orders: S/W 30 months probation with conditions (1 day credit in the event of probation revocation):  
 
- 90 days SCC jail to be served within 60 days. Huber approved for any reason the jail allows.  
- $268 court costs payable through clerk of court, continue on current payment plan 
- $250 DNA Surcharge payable through clerk of court, continue on current payment plan
- DNA Sample
- Absolute Sobriety 
- AODA or Rule 25 and follow through with all recommendations
- Cooperate with any assessment as deemed necessary through COMPASS or as requested by DOC.
- Subject to random testing by agent to monitor sobriety compliance. 


Report to probation by 1:00 pm today.

11:45 AM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Dennis Gerard Gentner.  Attys have reviewed the report.  Attys both agree that the court may make findings based on the report. Based on the report, Court finds that the DE is competent to stand trial. Atty Schutte states matter is likely resolved, asks to set PLEAS. Adjourned: 11:46 am
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Competency hearing on September 30, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Schutte in court for Dennis Gerard Gentner. Motion hearing - competency is raised. Court orders Competency Evaluation - out of custody. Def to meet and cooperate with Evaluator. Court to schedule 21 day internal review for further scheduling.

Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  A.W. Schutte   DF:  Dennis Gerard Gentner appeared. Case called at 2:58 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for an arraignment. Atty Schutte has received a copy of information. Reviewed with client. NG plea entered. Has not received discovery yet. Court schedules. Address confirmed. Court adjourned at 3:00 p.m.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on May 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  A.W. Schutte   DF:  Dennis Gerard Gentner appeared. Case called at 10:29 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a preliminary hearing. ADA Becker calls Officer Thomas to the Stand. S/T Steven Thomas. Employed with the City of River Falls Police Department. Direct by ADA Becker. Witness excused. ADA Becker calls Sgt. Anderson to the Stand. S/T Denton Anderson. Employed with the City of River Falls Police Department. Direct by ADA Becker. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Witness excused. No further evidence by either party. ADA Becker requesting bind over. Atty Schutte gives argument. Rebuttal by ADA Becker. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court schedules arraignment. Address confirmed. Bond continues. Court adjourned at 10:48 a.m.  Arraignment scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

re: withdrawal of objection. Filed by Atty Schutte. km
Per RMW: re-calendar 4/27 as a preliminary hearing. JA will set. tfy/km
Motion hearing on April 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J.A.C.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  A.W. Schutte   DF:  Dennis Gerard Gentner appeared. DE has a copy of complaint. Understands charges and penalties. Waives further reading. Atty Schutte notes some jurisdictional challenge. Will file motion by the 04/15/22. Court schedules for motion hearing. If case survives motion, will continue to preliminary hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Order for payment on April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
